name: Real Thai Green Curry Paste (Nam Prik Gen Kayo Wan)
author: Wiley
summary: This is a green curry paste recipe from central Thailand that incorporates the Indian spices of the South and the fresh herbs from the North. This recipe will make a bulk curry paste that will keep for a few weeks in the refrigerator and make several batches of curry. Fresh curry paste always makes your curries taste better than premade pastes that contain preservatives.
ingredients: 2 ½ ounces fresh Thai basil leaves, chopped
2 tablespoons peeled and chopped fresh turmeric root
directions: Combine green chiles, shallots, cilantro roots, garlic, Thai basil, lemongrass, galangal, kaffir lime peel, shrimp paste, cumin seeds, turmeric, coriander seeds, salt, and white pepper in a mortar and pestle; pound into a smooth paste
